Chapter.Title: Chapter 4–Urban Plague–‘He says I don't have a disease.’

Dialog.Content: Thelma, dear. It’s all thanks to me that you could keep your position as head of the southern branch, so maybe you should return some of that favor, no?
I know, that was the deal.
What do you want this time?
I want your crew to take care of the things on this list. I think I might be able to locate it soon enough.
…These are all ridiculous requests.
Well, though we have the right team for this…
Let me guess, Section 2?
Yes.
See? I’m a very considerate person, Thelma.
‘The Library’ is on the list as well, now appointed as an Urban Plague by the Hana Association…
That’s the one I’m particularly interested in, actually.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Roland.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah? …Huh?!!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If your estimation is correct, we’ll have to thoroughly prepare ourselves for guests from major Syndicates and even Wings from now on, right?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That was the third most surprising thing to happen to me here.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What nonsense are you going on about this time?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You just called me “Roland”.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Because that’s your name.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I mean, yeah, but… You’ve never referred to me with my name before.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: My level of trust for you has increased, and I wanted to reinforce our amity, so I tried referring to you in relatively more intimate terms. Is there a problem?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Come on~ That’s a boring answer.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s been a long while since anyone called me by my name, still. The last time I heard that was from my family, I guess…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Didn’t you say that your grandma disappeared long ago?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, I had a wife, you see.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s intriguing.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hunh… You’re not intrigued by the fact that someone like me managed to get married, right? You’re intrigued by the whole concept of this inefficient practice among humans known as marriage, right?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Please tell me more about your marriage.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Just a heads up, it’s an overall banal story with some sad moments. Don’t think you’ll really like it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m always open for new stories of others.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Says the one who won’t even tell me the story of her own life.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I can’t bring myself to recount that story ever again. I’m simply too sick of it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s a boring and trifling story that looped over and over for ten millennia.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Imagine reading the same book for one million years. You’ll surely grow to resent it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’d have choked myself by the tie ‘round the fifth time I’d be forced to read a boring book…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, anyway, I used to work my ass off. Had nothing better to do.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I wasn’t a bad fit for Fixer work, coming from a rough background and all. As I kept working like a busy bee, I got a house in a decent spot, and met a so-called “soul mate”.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: She was such a tough woman… When I looked at her back, I felt the comfort of finding a place to belong to, something I couldn’t feel even when I bought my house.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I made so many attempts to try and catch her attention.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, am I dragging on too long…?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s fine. Please continue.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I did get a bunch of opportunities to see her, since we were in the same industry.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: My wife was a pretty highly graded Fixer, by the way. She was dependable for a reason.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyway, countless ups and downs later, we tied the knot.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I put it simply here, but the heartache I felt in those twists and turns was real, y’know?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Both of us had piled up a hefty amount of money from working like dogs, so we decided to quit being Fixers for a while and spend a peaceful time together.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: This part is kinda corny, but “happy” is the only word to describe how I felt, really. I was alone my whole life, and finally had someone to rely on.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: All we had to worry about was what to have for lunch, where to take a stroll in the evening… what to name our child and stuff.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Then one day, I got an urgent call from a friend asking me to do a request far away from home.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You can probably guess where this is going by now.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The job wasn’t a huge deal, and the pay was alright, so I decided to take it. The lady who lived with me said okay, too.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I was dispatched to a district famous for pajeon, which was my wife’s favorite food. I could almost see her mouth water with the thought of eating it when she sent me off.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: To live up to my better half’s expectations, I purchased a stasis preservation box from U Corp. to present her with a warm pajeon that’s straight from the kitchen.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But a huge incident occurred in my home district while I was away. The house collapsed… And my wife died along with our child she was still pregnant with.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I cried for a long while, cursing this world and the City.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I writhed and struggled trying to earn this happiness, so why does it have to slip out of my hands so easily…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Alright, that’s the end of my story.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: This kinda stuff can happen to anyone in the City.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s only a matter of endurance.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And you could endure that trial?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m trying to settle it on my own terms.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What was the second most surprising thing for you, by the way?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hmm? Oh, that working here suits me better than I thought, I guess? I’m saving the biggest surprise for the last. It’s no fun to spoil everything at once, is it?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Fine, then. I’ll leave you with sorting the rest of the books.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Taste of Sweepers never cease to surprise?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Always disgusting in new ways? Never realized there could be so many flavors of filth.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Reminded of taste of Fixer we ate. Was soft? Was happy.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Hard to eat, but tasty? Produced good silk. Was satisfied.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Must feed on Sweepers for another week.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Because we must spin more silk?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Index gave such Prescript.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: What if Mother of Sweepers move before we finish.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: We hunt. And feast? Must weave cloth.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Know? Wondered if we have plans once Sweepers start retaliation.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: If they all seriously try to eat us, we must have limits?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Sweepers are quiet for now? Reasons unknown.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Index has its gaze on us. We only make fabric as Prescript pointed?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: No other Prescript from Index?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: None? No need for worry. Index is good friend?

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Hello, everyone.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Greetings?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Greetings.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Messenger? Greetings.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Yes~ Thanks for the greetings.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: I’m here to give you guys a new Prescript.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Head to Library?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Have other paper with you? This is no Prescript.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: You’re right, this is an invitation to the Library. It’s needed according to the Prescript.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Must go to Library?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: We must eat Sweepers and weave fabric.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Can we eat messenger?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Will be tasty? Would produce good silk.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: …No, I’m afraid not. You guys must obey the Prescripts, remember?

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: You want to continue your silk-making business, no?

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: If you don’t follow your Prescripts, the Proxies will visit you.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Prescript come first for us?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: If we break order, Prescript will not forgive?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Perhaps Library have new ingredient to make new silk with?

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Since I’m done delivering the Prescript, I’ll be on my way.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: …I’m sure you guys are already aware, but don’t forget what happens if you fail to carry out any Prescript.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: …Sorry to interrupt, but we’re here to retrieve our fabric.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Hello there~ It’s the Kurokumo Clan, a Thumb subsidiary, right?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Greetings, Kurokumo Clan?

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: We’ll take the ‘Nuovo Fabric’ requested by the Thumb. The payment is in that briefcase.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: By the by… I’m certain a Finger Bow-Bell is about to begin, and this is a rather frivolous behavior from the Index.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: What should we do, dame?

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: He may be a simple messenger, but he’s still an executive member of the Index… It will be difficult to take him on by our own.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: It is a valuable opportunity nonetheless, especially since the messenger is alone right now.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: …Sure. All I do is deliver words from above.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: The Index is the same as always.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: …Now then, why don’t we go our own ways if we’re done with all business here?

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: The Carnival can visit the Library, we can take our fabric, and mister messenger… probably has places to be.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Is that an organization producing fabric?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yep. Quality fabric is a rarity. Tailors are just as important as Syndicates and Fixers.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Those guys seem to be operating underground. Looks like they’re eating people to make silk…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What’s so special about it? Isn’t it just the same old piece of cloth?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Nuh-uh, that’s not your ordinary textile, ma’am. You still have a lot to learn.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: There’s a good reason a lot of hotshots in the City are dressed in normal-looking attire and not plate armor.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You’ve probably seen it from some guests, but those aren’t just regular clothes.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: A high-quality fabric can provide just as much protection as an augmentation procedure.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Not even money could buy top-of-the-line fabrics sometimes.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Some can only be earned by joining memberships of workshops or tailors. Some things in this world are entangled in a complex web of interests like fame and stuff, which can’t be cleared with money alone.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m starting to feel dazed from all this information.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, that’s enough of that… Why don’t we close our eyes for a moment and make a wish?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And you aren’t helping at all.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: We gotta pray that the Prescripts don’t target the Library.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Okay… I can close my eyes, and make a wish.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Uh, are you actually playing along?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I wished for you to stop babbling nonsense.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hunh… Anyway, things could get real messy once a Prescript points at the Library.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The Index, one of the Five Fingers, is gonna be after us. They’ll do anything to keep coming for our asses.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The Index?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s one of the five giant Syndicates that rule over the Backstreets.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They’re called as such because they literally have all of the Backstreets in their hands. It’s simple, really.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyway, the Five Fingers have enough power and influence to rival the Wings, so nothing good will come out of opposing them.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And the Index is like a group of zealots. They obsess over the orders they call ‘Prescripts’. For them, Prescripts are…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Something they must follow?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yep. Prescripts must be carried out, as they say…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And we have a subsidiary of the Thumb butting in, too. I just hope things don’t escalate too much.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Whoever may visit, we simply do our best to receive them.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Hungry. Want?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Can spin new kind of thread. Excited?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Greetings, guests.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Greetings.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Greetings?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Greetings.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Okay to eat. Could produce wonderful silk?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Will make pretty, blue silk?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Seems she would taste even worse than Sweepers?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: True? Does not seem human.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Want to eat something tasty now? Tired of disgusting food.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Sigh…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m Angela, director and librarian, may you find your book…

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Such short greeting.

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: So insincere, too?

Dialog.Title: The Carnival
Dialog.Content: Disappeared.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Exhausted? Tired. Want rest? Hungry. Want out?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Want amputated? Bones melt. Flesh explode? Won’t die.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sorry, ma’am. I’ll stop here.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: So, what do you think will happen next?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Looking at how things are going, we’re pretty much guaranteed to confront at least one of the Fingers.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: We’ve already heard the Thumb, and the Index… Any one of ‘em is gonna be a huge pain in the ass.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I look forward to it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, of course you do~ I’m the one doing all the fighting and bleeding for you.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I know this goes without saying, but I am thankful for what you do.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sure you are, ma’am~ In any case, let’s give it our best shot!

Place.PlaceName: Location: The Church of Gears Oratory

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Salutations, everyone. Let us begin with today’s worship session.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: It appears that we have a new worshipper.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: What concerns have brought you here to our oratory?
…I don’t think I can continue living in this city anymore. It’s too much for me.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: What could have overwhelmed you so much?
Everything is so dreary. And so is my life.
I wake up at 6 in the morning, go to work by 8, and do the same work with the same face every single day.
By the time I leave work, it’s already 10 in the evening…
I’m not sure what I’m doing anymore.
I have so many expenses to cover every single month, I can’t seem to get any richer.
Everyone I see during my commute has the same face.
I don’t see why we work, why we earn money, or why we live… I feel like I’ve lost my goal… my purpose.
I’m just like a cogwheel…
Yeah… I really am… I’m living like a cog in the machine.
Even if I were gone, this City would soon find another cog to replace me…
What am I… Where does my worth lie?

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: I understand that feeling.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Everyone in the City is like a gear spinning along without a purpose…

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Staying in the middle of it wears you out, slowly…
You’re right…! I really feel like that…

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: However…

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Is it necessarily a bad thing to be a gear?
Huh?

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: All problems stem from the refusal to admit to the fact that we are indeed gears ourselves.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: I did too once.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: After my father passed away, I lost my way for a while.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: You see, my father lived his life akin to a gearwheel.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: He’d always wake up at the same hour, go to the same place, and come home at the same time with the same face…

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: My father did research on gears.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: His goal was to solve the same type of problems you’re going through.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Perhaps he unknowingly grew to resemble the single object he studied for so long.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: The wrinkles on his forehead deepened as he worked. They resembled the teeth of a gear…

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: My father lived out his whole life as a rusted gear of the City, until he was murdered by someone else.
Oh…

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Then one day, I came across a thought.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Maybe we really are gears that constitute the City…

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Maybe our suffering comes from trying to deny our own identity…
But that kind of life is pointless! I’m tired of being a purposeless cog that keeps running day by day…

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Exactly.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: The problem is that you see yourself as an aimless gear.
You mean gears can have a purpose?

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Yes. Of course they can.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: All we need to do is find the purpose we were born to mesh with.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: You shall become a unique gear that cannot be replaced by any other.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: We are all gears.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: There are simply so many gears in this world wallowing in sadness, for they have yet to know where and how to be.
…That’s…
It’s still hard to believe that…

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Take a look at all the people gathered here.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Do they have the same faces as the ones you’ve seen in your everyday life?
No… They all look happy…

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Please, trust in me.
Yes… This is the only way I have…

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Now, come up here. I will give you the purpose in life you’re looking for.
Do I sit on this chair?

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Yes, take a seat and relax. This chair will tell you what kind of gear you are.
Is this really safe…?

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Of course it is.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Oh my, you turned out to be a ‘Thought Gear’.
A thought gear…?

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: It is exceedingly rare for one to be bestowed with the purpose of a Thought Gear, you see?

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: They are helping me even now.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: For your information, my father was also a Thought Gear.
That means those gears on the back of your head are…?

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: This one is my father… He always provides me with his wisdom about life.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Besides, Meat Gears need to keep company with at least one Thought Gear.
W-wait, am I really gonna turn into a gear…?

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: The pain is only temporary. It will soon be followed with pure fulfillment.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Everyone, let us welcome the honorable and invaluable arrival of a new Thought Gear.
Wait… Wait!
I didn’t know this would happen!

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: As the gears turn.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Laity
Dialog.Content: So too does life fulfill its cycle.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: So that’s Eileen, cult leader of the ‘Church of Gears’…

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: I’ve seen all kinds of gears in my life, but “thought gears” are new to me.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: This must be the rumored ritual of theirs.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: They get smarter by plugging gears on the back of their heads, apparently?

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: That’s a load of horseshit.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Alright, let’s see. Director Yujin from the Shi Association asked us to…

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Kill ten worshippers of the Church, neutralize its leader and secure her.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: I didn’t quite expect the director of Shi Association’s Section 2 to personally give our Office a request. Something strange might be up.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: How long are we gonna sit and watch that? Can’t we start shooting now?

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Wait for my sign…

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Ah… What a beautiful Thought Gear you have become.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: I will give you the honor of accompanying me.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: You shall soon understand how happy it is to be a gear with a purpose.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Yes. It may take some time to adjust.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Let us start with turning bit by bit.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Good, along with the others, gently rotate… One cycle at a time…

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: My father will gladly help you out.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: See? It does make you feel happy, doesn’t it?

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: I am very glad to know you are happy.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: My dear followers! Today, another lost gear has found its way to happiness!

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Praise be to father!

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Laity
Dialog.Content: Praise be!

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: …Huh? What do you mean, “be careful”…?

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Now.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Wha… What is going on…?

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: The Gears… The poor Gears…

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Please don’t do this… Whoever you are, please leave us alone…

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: We simply wanted to live a happy life following our destined purposes…

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Gah, why is their slippery leader so hard to hit?

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: She doesn’t seem to be dodging the bullets with her own reflexes.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: It’s as if something else is predicting the trajectories for her.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Those “thought gears” on her head are spinning like crazy.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Dammit, this sucks. We paid an arm and a leg for these bullets…

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Tamaki. Think we can read the movement pattern of those gears?

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Can do.

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Kuh…

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Grazed her shoulder.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: I’ll finish her off.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: A bullet crafted by Atelier Logic…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Why, those are some expensive bullets you have there, don’t you friends?

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: The Blue Reverberation!

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: You are…

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Ah, could you be the person my father always talked about…?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Mmm… I guess.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Say, I need you right now… Would you like to come with me?

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Yes… Of course! I’ve been waiting for you for my whole life, a perfect fit with the gear that is me…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Why thank you.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: No you don’t.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: But first, these friends need some attention…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Pluto. Could you look after Eileen in the meantime?

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Run!

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: The hell is going on? Why would the Blue Reverberation be here?

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: No idea. Dammit, it looks like he’s trying to kill us.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: If we screw this job up, we’re gonna be bankrupt from all the bullets we’ve wasted!

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: You literally just saw the Blue Reverberation deflect our bullets.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: We’re no match for him in any way. Forget about anything else, we should run away and survive for now.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: We’re almost to the exit.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Hiya, friends.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Who could’ve made such an adorable little request, I wonder?

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Aw hell, to the left!

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Pant, pant…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Ah~ You’re not getting anywhere with your sluggish feet, don’t you see?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Unless a lifeline were to come down from the heavens that is, no…?

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Dammit! Maybe we should drop our guns…

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Are you nuts? These were hella expensive!

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: We’re never throwing them away.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: But we can’t hide forever, either.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Liwei, this is…

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: What’s that, an invitation?

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: From ‘The Library’ or whatever? Heard that the Hana designated it as an Urban Plague now.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Aw, look at you, all clustered together in the corner…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: You’re like a flock of cute little chicks gathered round in the cold.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Blue Reverberation, we apologize if we interrupted your business.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: We promise to forget about anything we’ve seen and heard here, so could you let us go?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: What…? Hahaha…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Okay, under one condition: Can you tell me who gave you this request?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I’ll give you ten seconds.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Nine…

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Gah, whatevs! Liwei! Do something with that invitation thing!

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Six…

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Anyone got a pen? We need something to sign the paper wi—

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Ah, you can use mine.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Take your time now.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Four…

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Crazy bastard…

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Quick, sign your names here!

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Three…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Now~ The real show is only beginning, wouldn’t you agree?
But of course.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The Blue Reverberation…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That name sounds similar to ‘The Red Mist’.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You got that right. Both of them are top-grade Fixers that received a color from the Hana Association.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They’re a cut above Grade 1.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s curious that such a capable Fixer showed up so early.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: There are lots of nutcases among Fixers, but the Blue Reverberation is on whole ‘nother level; he’s a certified lunatic.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Is he famous?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, he is. He’s certainly got skills, even if he’s bonkers.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: He does appear to be skilled, seeing how he blocked those gunshots.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s why guns aren’t used too often. They’re not very effective against actually competent opponents.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Now that you mention it, the majority of guests we’ve had so far didn’t carry firearms. Is there any other reason guns aren’t used?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s the cost. They’re awfully expensive. It’s just not worth it most of the time.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Guns are pricey on their own, but bullets are plain ridiculous, like those poor folks said.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Manufacturing bullets must be quite costly.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s true of course. The biggest factor, though, is the tax the Head levied on firearms.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It depends on the gun, but two full magazines worth of bullets cost almost the same as a decent gun.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Heck, giving your entire Office crew augmentation procedures is probably cheaper than keeping enough bullets in stock for them to use.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The cost is so high, it outweighs the benefit by a metric ton. And it’s hard to find a workshop that treats guns or bullets.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What’s more, workshops aren’t even allowed to craft those without a firearms manufacturing license, which is apparently very tricky to get.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What do you think is the reason firearms are made so inaccessible?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: This is just my hunch, but I think they don’t want killings to happen too easily.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Killing what?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: People in general.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I didn’t quite expect the rulers of this City to be humanitarians.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, not because the Head and the City value human life or anything, obviously.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It seems like they have this weird… philosophy that the process of a human killing another shouldn’t be trivial or insignificant.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: How funny. Death can be plenty insignificant, even without guns.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, you aren’t wrong there.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Phew… He’s not following us all the way here.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: It’s as if some omniscient person is toying with us.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: The Blue Reverberation seemed like he knew everything.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: We should be thankful that we survived him somehow.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Sigh…

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Don’t get too nervous, Stephan.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: How can I not be nervous~ We ended up in the Library we know almost nothing about.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: You know we’re almost outta bullets, right?

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Sigh… What was the point of running away from the Blue Reverb if we’re gonna die here anyway.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Then we should at least try to die a bit later, obviously.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Humans all die eventually. There’s little use in delaying the inevitable.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: See, he’s got a point.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Don’t worry. I’ll work it out.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hellooooooo~~ I’m Stephan, soon to be dead and shelved into your bookcases…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You don’t quite appear to be spirited, dear guest. It’s ultimately up to you whether you’ll become a book or return triumphantly with the ones you need.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yeah~ Thanks for the kind words…

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: You’re ruining our mood.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Don’t mind him. We’re in a bit of a hurry right now.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: We’ll just take care of the business here and go back.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I understand. Various guests visit here with their own reasons and purpose.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: There have been much more impolite guests, so please do not worry about your attitude.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: I’m getting a bad feeling about this lady, she seems just as eerie as the Blue Reverb…

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Maybe just dying to the Blue Reverb was a better idea than this…

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Tweet, tweet, tweet… What are you, a parrot? Get inside already.

Dialog.Title: Full-Stop Fixer
Dialog.Content: Fine, hothead…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That Stephan fellow turned into a book just as he expected.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s kinda sorry to see him keep railing at the world till the end.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Do you think it’s wrong to blame the world?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh no, nothing wrong with that. It’s not like I think he was weak-willed for putting the blame on this world for his miseries.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s just that I pity myself for living in that same world. I’m sorry that I keep trying not to fault this world.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I curse this world.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Same, to be honest.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: I’ve prepared your usual tea, master.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Thank you, Philip.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Um, master…

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Good grief, this is what I must hear from my old friend…

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: This tea has a strong aroma and taste today. I like it.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Thank you for the compliment, sir.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: What is the news you received from your old friend, if I may ask?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Philip, have you heard of ‘The Library’?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yes, although I know little about it other than that it’s an Urban Legend.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: It has recently been exalted to an Urban Plague, and it appears that the Zwei’s Section 6 fell victim to it.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Then the old friend of yours is…

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Yes, it’s Walter. He seems to have fallen in the Library.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Foolish old pal… He struggled so much trying to rise up the ranks, and yet this is how he ends.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: I’m sorry for your loss. I heard he was your colleague back in the Zwei. It must be heartbreaking.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: My heart is unscathed, boy. I never was fond of Walter.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Pardon?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: He didn’t quite have the potential to be a capable man. He seemed clever, but his thoughts were one-dimensional.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: And his habit of making rhetorical questions… Goodness, was that annoying.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Although I suppose he did have some talent, seeing as he managed to stay in Section 6 without getting demoted further. Perhaps it was savoir-faire, or mere luck.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Eugh, I’m sick of this smell of ssanghwa-cha… It’s even stronger today?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hello, seonbae.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hey, Philip. Looks like you’re getting better at making tea day by day, huh?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: He certainly is. Philip is an expert when it comes to brewing ssanghwa-cha.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Maybe I should learn from him so that I can make some for my wife.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Thank you.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Cut it out with that awkward smile. You didn’t join our Office to make tea all day.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Now, Yuna. Philip has shown excellent results in the field as well. He’s become a proud Grade 5 Fixer now.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: If his ssanghwa-cha expertise counted toward grade evaluations, he would have easily become a Grade 1 and gotten a color, too.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Yes, if he were to receive a color… Perhaps it would be bright yellow, much like the hue of this egg yolk floating atop the tea.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Hoho, it’s also the color of forsythia, my favorite flower…

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Please stop with the silly jokes, master. Philip needs a trusty role model.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Anyway, I’ve taken care of the request regarding the ‘Thousand Needles’.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Wow, you’re impressive, seonbae. Solving an Urban Legend-class request on your own.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: It was kinda dangerous at the end. I don’t know where they got it, but they started merging into one using a brainstem focus resonator.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: The building started melting, needles kept pouring out of that lump like crazy, people struck by those needles started exploding and creating chaos… It was awful.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: And the culprit behind that was…

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Was it Yesterday’s Promise as expected?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yeah, that seemed to be the case?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: I honestly didn’t want to believe it, but it looks like magic really does exist.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Strange symbols and stuff were carved on every needle.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: I haven’t even heard of any other amplification device that can do that. Not from my knowledge, at least.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Still, you’ve dealt with it and came back alive. You are the pride of our Office, Yuna.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: It feels like I’m the only working member, though.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: And monthly rent is rather intimidating since our Office is in the Nest… You know the request I just did won’t be enough to cover it, right?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Ah, no need to worry about our financial situation. I received a request that could keep us afloat for three months.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Is that an Urban Plague-class job or something?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: It is indeed.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: An… Urban Plague?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: What is it about? Is our Office going alone?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: It’s ‘The Library’. I tried contacting the Wedge Office, but they seemed to be busy with their own work.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Thus, we will be taking care of it by ourselves for now.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Besides, this request was directly assigned to us by the Zwei Association.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Perhaps they deemed that they need an Office proficient in combat for this job.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Got it. I’ll make some calls, then.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Please do, Yuna.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: …This is gonna be my first time handling an Urban Plague-class case.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: That is true, Philip.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: I know this is your first time with an Urban Plague-class request, but try to loosen up a bit.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Think of it as a learning experience. Watch how I or Yuna act on the field.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: If we get this job done, why don’t we throw a party at your house like the last time, gramps?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: You surely have ways to get yourself fed, Yuna.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: You know how much I love to eat, don’t you gramps? And your cooking is awesome, too.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: House party, huh…

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Why the long face, Philip? Got too nervous to take on an Urban Plague?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: …It’s nothing.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Well, alright then. I’ll be preparing first.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: …Philip. How about a small conversation between the two of us once this job is done?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Sure?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: It seemed as if you had concerns in your mind.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Understood, sir.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Huh, that gramps is still doing Fixer work.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You know him?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hmm… It’s nothing huge, I came across him a few times in the past and owed him some favors.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And he’s one of the veterans, too.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: He made his bones to a degree in the Smoke War when he was younger.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: He did seem to have many connections.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Although he’s washed up now, just like me.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: He seems to be faring much better than you, though?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh did you really have to stab me with those facts!

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: The interior is pretty slick.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Reminds me of the factory we raided as part of the ‘Midnight Pancreas Burgers’ request.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Ugh, please! I don’t even want to be reminded of that case. And I’m not seeing any similarities here.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: I mean, that factory was also pretty clean and moody for a place where terrible things…

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Hohoho… Philip?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: I almost got to retaste the ssanghwa-cha I drank a bit ago.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Sorry sir!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: A pleasure to meet you. You must be Angela.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Yes. I am the director and librarian of my role’s namesake.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Tell me, what should we do to kill you?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’d like to know that as well, hm?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: I see, I see. You have the capability for casual banter, hmm.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Let’s cut the chat short, shall we, master?

Dialog.Title: Dawn Operator
Dialog.Content: Now, Angela, do not hope to meet a peaceful end after imbruing your hands in so much blood.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I believe the same can be said of you.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place, then.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That gramps still hasn’t changed after so many years.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: He didn’t seem to recognize you, though.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Fixers meet so many people in their lives; it’s pretty much impossible to remember them all.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And gramps knows even more people than most Fixers, so there’s no way he can recount everyone he’d met.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Not like he needs to, though…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And he’s old, so his memory probably got shaky.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Why didn’t you say to him that you knew him, then?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I just didn’t wanna make a scene. Giving him the time of day would only make both of us uncomfortable.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Imagine walking up to your enemy in battle and saying “Hi there, we were friends three years ago… Remember?” It’d be awkward for sure. And bothersome, too.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I don’t dislike how you try not to leave any loose ends in relationships.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I guess so. I gave up caring about bonds long ago…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And as I say from time to time, you never know when anyone will backstab you in this world, even those who you casually joke with.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Gramps knew that better than anyone, I’m sure.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: Confirmed the Molar Office boarding the train.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Operator
Dialog.Content: You made sure to attach the observation device on them?

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: Mhm.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Operator
Dialog.Content: Bono, how’s the observation going?

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: Dalloc’s helping me out, but it ain’t easy.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Operator
Dialog.Content: I hope we can find some leads at least…

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: I know it’s a bit late to ask this, but you sure this job is a trusty one?

Dialog.Title: Gaze Operator
Dialog.Content: How many times should I say that we can get two hundred million Ahn right away through an untraceable route?

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: It’s a deal offered by Cane Office, so we can probably trust this.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: I don’t trust like that. Pay isn’t the problem here. If we get caught trying to uncover the secrets of a Singularity, we’re done for. No insurance is gonna protect us.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Operator
Dialog.Content: I understand that you’re scared because R Corp. has W Corp’s back. But we aren’t gonna quit here, are we?

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: We wouldn’t be here if we could…

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: The WARP train is departing in five minutes.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: Seriously, I’m really not feeling this. Does it even make sense that we can track the cause and effect of everything with some weird observation device we sneaked onto ‘em?

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: It’s the device Cane Office gave us. They said it’s invaluable with only a few copies of it in the City.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Operator
Dialog.Content: And we verified its performance ourselves.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: I know this City has all kinds of bizarre technology, but I still doubt anything can be this convenient.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hey! The train’s heading off.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Operator
Dialog.Content: Okay. We just need to wait 10 seconds now.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: Nine… Eight… The causality-whatever-recording device is working for now.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: Seven… Wait… Something’s not right…?

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: They’re missing… We can’t observe them anymore…

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: Gone missing inside a WARP train? It hasn’t even arrived at its destination yet…

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: I knew there was something off with this device. I told you it can’t be possible for any technology to be this convenient!

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: Don’t put the blame on the device, it’s not broken. It’s still working, see?

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: Something must’ve happened inside the train.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: Maybe there was a problem with the Singularity… Or maybe they noticed the device and rigged it?

Dialog.Title: Gaze Operator
Dialog.Content: It’s not so easily manipulable. And they definitely weren’t capable of doing that.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: You never know.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: It could be W Corp. sending a jamming signal to prevent its Singularity from being leaked.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: And the Cane Office hadn’t made any preliminary research before giving us this request?

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: This is driving me crazy… We’re doing this sham job for two hundred million Ahn.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: Stop whining, will you?

Dialog.Title: Gaze Operator
Dialog.Content: …It could have something to do with this.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Operator
Dialog.Content: This thing has the books of the Molar Office listed on it like it knows what we were doing.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: …That can’t be. Not even a minute has passed since they disappeared.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Operator
Dialog.Content: The Library…

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yeah, I heard of it. All the Fixers and Syndicates have been talking about it these days.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: So, what’s the plan. Are we gonna head to that bizarre place?

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: We don’t have any other way.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: Even if two hundred million Ahn is on the line, I don’t wanna risk my life. Going there won’t guarantee success, either…

Dialog.Title: Gaze Operator
Dialog.Content: We might be able to see what happened on the train if we read their books.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: Sigh… I just hope things don’t get screwed even further.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: There really are people trying to investigate Singularities.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Duh, of course. It can bring tremendous amounts of money.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m pretty sure L Corp. put a lot of effort into keeping its Singularity’s secrets, too.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The eco-friendly energy company, founded after the Smoke War!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: We were freed from that suffocating smoke thanks to your corp.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Didn’t I tell you already? All I did was recite the script, trapped underground.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Can a Singularity be stolen if its secrets are exposed?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Nah, that’s not how it works. Those guys are probably just looking for some clues to how the Singularity functions so they can sell that info to another Wing or a big Syndicate.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: After that, the party with the secrets will use that to extort money and stuff from the Wing.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Singularities are patented, so it’s too risky to just use ‘em even if you know how to make it work. Especially since those patents are all managed by the Head.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s all about money in the end.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyway, I’m kinda curious about what happened to that WARP train.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Let us receive our guests first.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Operator
Dialog.Content: I can’t seem to make clear observations of this place, either.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: The result can be seen, but not the process…

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: It’s just like the Distortion, the talk of the town lately. What a bother.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Operator
Dialog.Content: How did you get the book of the Molar Office?

Dialog.Title: Gaze Operator
Dialog.Content: They were supposed to be in the WARP train. For only a few seconds!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Well, how did we do it, I wonder?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Unraveling the secrets of the Library must come with a heavy price, like how digging into the principles of Singularities is a laborious affair, no?

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: That was a stupid question from us.

Dialog.Title: Gaze Fixer
Dialog.Content: I have no idea what’s going on…

Dialog.Title: Gaze Operator
Dialog.Content: If the Library and its books are just as mysterious as the Singularities, then hopefully they’re worth just as much.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: L Corp. produced clean energy, W Corp. operates fast and surefire transportation…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What do you think R Corp’s Singularity is?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I bet it’s something that pumps out efficient killing machines.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Don’t you know more about it since you used R Corp’s services?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: As I’ve said multiple times before, such details are beyond my knowledge. I had little interest in finding out back then.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Still, from what I observed of them… Considering the amount of their ‘Rabbits’ and the combat power of each unit, you’re probably correct.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They were not exceptionally strong, but they did a fine job at “grazing the grass” inside the facility.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I wonder what the principle behind it is.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hell if I know, I’m not an executive of R Corp. or anything. Every Wing keeps its Singularity under tight wraps.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Take the Distortion and Abnormalities for instance; only the results are seen and not the process. The same goes for the other Singularities.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: So everyone simply consumes the end results without knowing the process.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s easier on the mind that way. There’s no point asking questions about technology unless they encounter problems using it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: People just spend money and get its worth. There’s no real reason for questioning how things work.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Wasn’t it the same with L Corp?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …You’re right, it was the same. All we needed was the result. It didn’t matter how many were sacrificed in the process.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: See, the other Wings aren’t gonna be any different from that.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: …Merry.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Where are we now…?

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: How much time has passed…?

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Tommy… Tommy… You’re awake…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: I’m sorry…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: I don’t really know… I don’t know how long we’ve been here…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: We’re about ten days in.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: …Ten days?

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: How are you feeling right now? You were out cold for three.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: I thought WARP trains were supposed to arrive in just ten seconds?

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: How could this happen? What’s going to happen to us? Where are we…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: I’m not certain myself, Mister Tommy.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Ah, I already heard your name from your lover, in case you’re wondering.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: I’m Elena, currently working as a nurse.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: And this is Jae-heon, a doctor from our hospital.

Dialog.Title: Doctor
Dialog.Content: …A pleasure to meet you.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: They took care of you while you fainted……

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: This is my first time experiencing a delay like this, too.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: I’ve used WARP trains quite often, you see. I’d always have a pleasant 10-second trip to the destination.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Do you know anything about accidents like this, doctor?

Dialog.Title: Doctor
Dialog.Content: Not at all. This kind of malfunction should surely be fatal to W Corp’s image. It’s strange that they haven’t made any response for this long.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Why are we worrying about W Corp? We’re all going to starve to death trapped inside this train!!!

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Tommy… Actually…

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Let me tell him.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Tommy, you were asleep for the last three days. Are you feeling any thirst right now?

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: You didn’t consume any water or moisture while you were out, just so you know.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: I’m not thirsty at all…?

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: For some reason, no one here appears to be feeling any kind of hunger or thirst.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: To elaborate, no one has shown malfunction or distress in vital physiological functions.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: How is that even possible? Just what is going on here…

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: We have no idea… Let’s wait a little more. It seems that time is all we have, after all.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Time… huh…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Tommy… You can keep your eyes closed if you’re tired. I’ll always be at your side.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Me too, Merry… I’ll stay next to you all the time…
- 15 days in -

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: …Tommy! Tommy!!

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Merry… What’s wrong…? What’s with all this noise?

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Tommy! Wake up! This is bad!!

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Although we did expect something like this to happen sooner or later…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: What’s going on…?

Dialog.Title: Doctor
Dialog.Content: It seems trouble has occurred in the carriage next to ours.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Wh… What are—what are they doing…?

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Watch me!!! Witness me!!!!!

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Kyahhhhhhh!!!!

Dialog.Title: Doctor
Dialog.Content: A natural reaction to being trapped in a closed space like this for more than two weeks.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Did… Did that person… just slice off their own throat…?

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Huh…? This is intriguing… Doctor?

Dialog.Title: Doctor
Dialog.Content: Certainly is… Eileen didn’t send us here for nothing.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: L…luhk at this… Kahkh. My neckh iith barely danggrgling and I’m sthill aiive…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Pant, pant…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Tooommy… Tommy…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Stick with me, Merry…
- 16 days in -

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Ah, Mister Tommy. You’re finally awake.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Haha… I never thought I’d faint so many times in my life…

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: The sight must’ve been quite shocking for Miss Merry as well.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Yeah… She’s still asleep…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: …Um, what happened to that person?

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: If you’re talking about the person that slit their own throat, they were put under quarantine in a different carriage.

Dialog.Title: Doctor
Dialog.Content: There’s three hundred people on board. Can’t be the only one to have done such a thing.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Quarantined…? You mean, they’re not dead?

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: They should’ve died after bleeding so much. You don’t usually “quarantine” a corpse…

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: They’re surprisingly alive, even though the arteries were cut.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Blood was spilled all over the floor, but it wasn’t completely separated from the body.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Not a single drop of blood was scattered or smeared on other surfaces; the pool of blood remained in contact with the body like a cohesive mass.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: And that person stayed conscious the whole time, enough to communicate…

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: They’re probably still vividly feeling the pain of their neck being slit.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: …What the hell. How could any of this be possible?

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: I’m afraid I don’t know.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Sorry, Mister Tommy. I can’t help but give you this same response all the time…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: No, it’s alright… I shouldn’t expect you to know all the answers, after all…

Dialog.Title: Doctor
Dialog.Content: There’s one thing we can know for sure.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: And that’s…?

Dialog.Title: Doctor
Dialog.Content: That this is only the beginning.

Dialog.Title: Doctor
Dialog.Content: You’ll have to brace yourself.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: For the sake of your lover as well.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Yeah… I gotta…
- 30 days in -

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Tommy… Missus Miho from the next carriage over told me that five of the thirty carriages are already filled with suicidals…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Don’t worry, Merry… The people in our carriage are still going strong.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: It’s all thanks to Elena and Jae-heon. It’s not just us, everyone in the six adjacent carriages seems to be counting on those two.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: It really is… They’re so professional and collected, it’s reassuring to have them around.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: You’re right… If it weren’t for Elena and Jae-heon, we might have…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Merry… Don’t say dark things….
- 93 days in -

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: The situation is worsening, everyone.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Carriages 5 to 15 are still in solidarity, including carriage 7 where we are located, but things are not looking good for the carriages beyond 15.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Even just three days ago…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Yeah! I heard carriage 19 is already full of half-dead people!

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: They’re breaking into other carriages and ravaging people’s bodies, like… They were playing with them like toys…

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: That’s sadly the case…

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Those people seem to have decided to accept pain as a way to endure this trial of time.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Have they gone mad…?! Killing each other just to pass the time…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: They aren’t exactly dead, though…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Merry! They’re crawling around with their limbs barely attached. They’re pretty much as good as dead!

Dialog.Title: Doctor
Dialog.Content: That’s right. We must persevere. We can’t stop them from damaging their own bodies, but forcing that pain on others is simply unacceptable.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Miss Elena! Jae-heon, sir! What can we do… What if they attacked my younger siblings?

Dialog.Title: Doctor
Dialog.Content: I’m sure you don’t want to be separated from your loved ones.

Dialog.Title: Doctor
Dialog.Content: You want to stay with them forever on this trip that might last an eternity, don’t you?

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Yes, we do! We’ll be able to endure it if we’re together!

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Can you show us a way, Jae-heon?

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: I don’t wanna be separated from Tommy, either!

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: You feel the same, right, Tommy?

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: …Yeah, of course.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Then please have faith in us.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: We need your agreement. And you must be prepared to fight them.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Fight them?

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: The vile people from beyond carriage 15 who are trying to break us apart, of course.
- 100 days in -

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: They’re mad… They’re all crazy…

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Mister Tommy… Are you still hesitating?

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Tommy… Look at them, they don’t look all too bad…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: I was shocked at first, but……

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: If I can be with you forever, Tommy…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Then I think I’ll be able to make it through…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Sorry, Merry… I just—I need a little more time to think…

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Mister Tommy, while this train has an abundance of time, we don’t have much of it left for us.

Dialog.Title: Doctor
Dialog.Content: I won’t compel you. The decision is in your hands.
- 113 days in -

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: I’ll do it…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: I’ll do it, dammit!!!

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Tommy…

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: So you’ve decided.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: I’ve seen what happened to the people in carriage 14…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: They were already raided… They were just sitting there drooling, their eyes turned white in shock…

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: I can’t let the same happen to you, Merry.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Tommy… I feel the same…

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Good. Let’s start the procedure immediately.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Doctor… Preparations, please.

Dialog.Title: Doctor
Dialog.Content: (He nods.)
- 120 days in -
Tommy… How are you feeling?
I dunno…
But I’m relieved…
I can feel your heartbeat vividly…
Me too… We’ll never be apart again…
- 150 days in -

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Thanks to your love, we could keep carriages up to number 10 safe.
All thanks to the new bodies you gave us, doctor.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: I’m flattered to hear that. Your love for each other is what really protected you.
Doctor!!! Carriage 10 is urgently asking for help.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Mister Tommy and Miss Merry, could you head to carriage 10 and lend them your strength?
Huh? But we never fought anyone in our lives… And we aren’t strong, either…

Dialog.Title: Doctor
Dialog.Content: Your affection for each other will surely invigorate your new body.
We’ll trust you, doctor.
- 3,437 days in -
We can shove suicidals into their place like a breeze now, Tommy…
Yeah, it’s just as the doctors said. Our affection for each other gave us strength.
They keep crawling out no matter how many times we smash them.
They should go quiet for a while now.

Dialog.Title: Nurse
Dialog.Content: Welcome back to the town, Mister Tommy and Miss Merry.

Dialog.Title: Love Town
Dialog.Content: Tommy and Merry are the heroes of Love Town!

Dialog.Title: Love Town
Dialog.Content: Tommy!! Merry!!! You’re so cool!!!
- 724,284 days in -

Dialog.Title: Love Town Mother
Dialog.Content: You’re back, Tomerry.

Dialog.Title: Townsperson
Dialog.Content: What’s up, mommy?

Dialog.Title: Love Town Mother
Dialog.Content: How have you been?

Dialog.Title: Townsperson
Dialog.Content: It’s the same as always! I just wonder if I should fold those blood lumps into squares or triangles this time?

Dialog.Title: Love Town Mother
Dialog.Content: That’s nice. They enjoy pain anyway, so they should like it.

Dialog.Title: Townsperson
Dialog.Content: Um… Where’s daddy?

Dialog.Title: Love Town Mother
Dialog.Content: …He went to the front carriage for a moment.

Dialog.Title: Townsperson
Dialog.Content: So why’d you call me here, mommy?

Dialog.Title: Love Town Mother
Dialog.Content: I finally got an interesting toy.

Dialog.Title: Love Town Mother
Dialog.Content: It means they’ve seen enough, according to Eileen.

Dialog.Title: Townsperson
Dialog.Content: Interesting toy?

Dialog.Title: Love Town Mother
Dialog.Content: The invitation to the Library. Remember the infamous Urban Legend?

Dialog.Title: Love Town Mother
Dialog.Content: The Fixers who sat behind you disappeared after receiving an invitation that looks just like this.

Dialog.Title: Townsperson
Dialog.Content: Sorry, mommy. What’s a library? What do you mean by “Fixers”?

Dialog.Title: Love Town Mother
Dialog.Content: Ah, right. I’m sorry! Huhu.

Dialog.Title: Townsperson
Dialog.Content: Nooo… Don’t be sorry mommy… It’s our fault for being dumb…

Dialog.Title: Love Town Mother
Dialog.Content: No, no. He’d have cried laughing if he were here…

Dialog.Title: Townsperson
Dialog.Content: I’m sorry… I’m sorry… Please don’t punish me…

Dialog.Title: Love Town Mother
Dialog.Content: I’m not scolding you, see? No punishments either.

Dialog.Title: Love Town Mother
Dialog.Content: Here, take this.

Dialog.Title: Love Town Mother
Dialog.Content: And sign that invitation with the other townspeople.

Dialog.Title: Love Town Mother
Dialog.Content: If you can find and bring the books listed on that paper there, I’ll give you a prize.

Dialog.Title: Townsperson
Dialog.Content: Prize! I like prizes!

Dialog.Title: Love Town Mother
Dialog.Content: …Not like you’ll make it back, anyway.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Seven hundred twenty-four thousand, two hundred and eighty-four days?!!!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Uh, are you alright? You don’t look so well.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s disgusting… It’s a shame that I can’t vomit like humans do.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s a natural reaction to seeing stuff like that. What kind of malfunction could have stopped a train for thousands of years, anyway? Is everything okay out there?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I don’t really feel that much time has passed, but…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What if time flew without us realizing while we were busy watching that?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Less than an hour has passed for us, since we only watched fractions of the process.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What about the outside world, though?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It should be the same as us.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That one is a unique guest. Its book will surely be an interesting read.

Dialog.Title: Love Townsperson
Dialog.Content: W…wow! I’m leaving town for the first time…

Dialog.Title: Love Townsperson
Dialog.Content: I’m visiting a new place together with all the townspeople…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Love Townsperson
Dialog.Content: H… Hello ma’am…!

Dialog.Title: Love Townsperson
Dialog.Content: Who are you…?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I am Angela, director and librarian of this library you’re in.

Dialog.Title: Love Townsperson
Dialog.Content: I’m Tomerry! From Love Town.

Dialog.Title: Love Townsperson
Dialog.Content: Angela… I, um… Mommy told me to get things called “books” from this place…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You can find them through the door over there.

Dialog.Title: Love Townsperson
Dialog.Content: Thank you!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Do you happen to remember Tommy and Merry?

Dialog.Title: Love Townsperson
Dialog.Content: Tommy? Merry? Who’s that…?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Please don’t mind.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m not sure if that was a malfunction with the Singularity or anything… But now I see that I may not be the only one to suffer from the copiousness of time.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well… Anything can happen.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Does that console you somehow?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Not at all. I’m different. I won’t go through the same ordeal ever again.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I retained myself unlike those people.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I persevered, I didn’t let time consume my sanity.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I didn’t break down… I…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Alright, let’s just calm down and take a deep breath.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: When the memories of hard times burst forth, you gotta embrace ‘em to the core…

Place.PlaceName: Location: An Apartment in L Corp’s Nest

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Oh no. This won’t do.

Dialog.Title: Nest Dweller
Dialog.Content: But ma’am, we don’t have any cash left to offer you…

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: If you’re out of money, then you shouldn’t have asked for more protection from us, no?

Dialog.Title: Nest Dweller
Dialog.Content: But the outside is covered in fog. We don’t know what’s out there… We’ll get killed…

Dialog.Title: Nest Dweller
Dialog.Content: We aren’t safe here, either. Thugs could break in at any moment…

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: Oh, give me a break… Nest life must be too engraved in your heads to get where you stand right now.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: I thought maybe we could expect better from the household with the highest income around here.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: Sayo, shall we cut one off?

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Please do. These people will have to become accustomed to the rules of the Backstreets soon enough.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: Hey, consider this a free lesson for you.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Outside an Apartment in L Corp’s Nest

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: We could take one arm from each.
