Dialog.Title: Nest Dweller
Dialog.Content: Please have mercy on us… You can’t be such heartless people…

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: And did you spare any mercy for us while we struggled in the Backstreets, covered in filth and blood? No, you simply spectated our suffering from the comfort of the Nest, did you not?

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: It’s rather infuriating now that I think about it. Yang, let us take an eye from them as well.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: Yes, dame~

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: Got your arms first.

Dialog.Title: Nest Dweller
Dialog.Content: We didn’t ask for this, you people came into our house all of a sudden and threatened us to pay protection money…

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: So have we kept you safe or not? I’m pretty sure we took care of all the bad guys trying to get here.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: And got your eyes as well~

Dialog.Title: Nest Dweller
Dialog.Content: What do we do… How are we gonna live now…

Dialog.Title: Nest Dweller
Dialog.Content: The Nest fell so suddenly…

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: What a bunch of crybabies. We’re being quite generous as Backstreets businesses go.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Now, now~ We’ll be going then. Please don’t forget today’s lesson:

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: If you receive something, you should return that favor accordingly. Imagine if it was the Ring protecting this area, not us…

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Dear, the thought alone is terrifying.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Oh, and please leave this house by tomorrow.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Gin, confiscate the apartment deed from these people, will you?

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: You’ll be visited by much less pleasant fellows next time, so you’d better move out as soon as possible~

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Now then, we’ve collected the protection money and got our fabric… Shall we go back and pay our due credit?

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Ah, by the way, Gin. How is the current situation with L Corp’s Nest?

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: It’s fierce. This is the first time in a long while the Thumb and the Index got in a turf war over an area.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: Everyone must be thinking this is the promised estate or something.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: The same can be said for us, no?

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: On another note, the ‘Rusted Chains’ already proved to be an issue, but we’ve been colliding with ‘Blade Lineage’ more often these days.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Perhaps we should have a friendly conversation with them before the tension overheats.

Place.PlaceName: Location: L Corp’s Nest - Residential Area

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: Khurf…

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: Run, dame…

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: What are you.
Sup fellas?
Got some gains with your business?

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: She has the head of a dog? A dog in black coat?

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Are those kinds of surgeries hip with the kids these days?

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: Captain, that appears to be the one recently dubbed as ‘L'heure du Loup’.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Oh? So she’s a wolf, not a dog? Still appears to be a little bitch to me.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Funny, innit? Laugh while you can.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Let’s see, we have around a hundred Kurokumo punks ‘ere.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: You speak as if you can take us all on.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: That’s the plan, yeah.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Let us teach that pup a lesson.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Pah. Weaksauce.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: I coulda crushed you like bugs even before I turned into what I am now.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Alright, why don’tcha gather round and kneel.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: The dead… Welp, they can’t be helped.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: …What is it that you want?

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Ehey, I have plenty of wants, gal.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Wanna have a ton of cash in my hands.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Wanna live in a Nest for once, too.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: …But before any of that, I wanna make some music.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Clan
Dialog.Content: Fucking hell… Shut your yap already…

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Whoa~ Look at their skull go. Flew right outta the park, homerun.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: Tell us what you demand from us.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Oh, ah, what I want from you guys?

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Right, that was the point.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: First off, the piece of cloth you’re carrying? Gimme that.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: …This Nuovo Fabric is for the Thumb, though?

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: My boss showed interest in that thing. Heard that’s a pretty nice cut o’ cloth.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Guess he wants us to suit up before the performance.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: You must know the consequences of making an enemy of the Thumb.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: The Thumb? Pft, tell ‘em to bring it on. I’mma smash ‘em all.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Oh, and take your goons to the Library, will ya?

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: The Library…? The building that is rumored to be at the center of this Nest?

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Yep, that thing.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: So you are after the wealth this land can bring, after all.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: I told ya that’s not it.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: I do wanna earn some bucks, but music comes first.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: But for what reason…

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Beats me. My boss…

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: No, I mean the orchestrator of our ensemble wants us to get rid of all those noisy Syndicates like the Thumb or the Index so that we can make some music.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: In fancy suits, too.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: And help out the Library while we’re at it.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Help out the Library?

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Shush, gal. Keep your eyes low if you don’t wanna get dead.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Anyways, you guys can take this and head to the Library like I said.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Go on ahead.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: C’mon, get going already.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: If you don’t use that invitation right now, I’ll kindly remove all the bones from your flesh.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: …Let us prepare to go, everyone.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: Your hands are shaking, galie. You sure you’re alright? Are ya mad at me by any chance?

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: …No, it’s nothing.

Dialog.Title: L’heure du Loup
Dialog.Content: And one more thing: If you run off without the books in your hands, you’re also dead to me.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That was quite intense.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Looks like the Fingers are fiercely wrestling for the ownership of the Nest that L Corp. once had reign over.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Why would they, though?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Ever heard of holdouts? When a Wing is broken, its Nest collapses and gradually turns into a slum akin to the Backstreets.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It becomes a lawless land without an owner to uphold anything.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Then a bunch of Syndicates come rushing in to occupy the land in advance.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What happens next?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The vacancy in the Wings won’t stay open forever; when a new Wing rises and gets assigned a Nest, the Syndicate resells that land to the Wing.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Of course, the Wing can choose to hire Fixers or other Syndicates to kick out that Syndicate with force instead, but that’s another story.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What will happen to the feathers living in the Nest?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Those folks? Well, they’re all on their own.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hire a Fixer, or get evicted to the Backstreets, or try and join another Wing, or anything. A Nest without its Wing is no longer a safe haven for its residents.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s typical of the City.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: If you can’t grasp whatever opportunities you find with your own hands, you’re bound to fall behind.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I wonder what’s up with that puppy, anyway.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …That looked like a case of the Distortion.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Distortion? That’s not exactly what I imagined.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Indeed. She appears to be highly rational.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You call that rational?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: She seems much more rational than you are, at the very least.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: Sigh… This was not meant to be.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Where the hell did that bitchhead come from?!

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: How dare an impudent whelp like her bite at us superior beings!

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: Calm down, Captain. Let’s report this to the Thumb right after we take care of this.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Huu… Yes, let us do that.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: It’s ridiculous that someone could treat us Kurokumo Clan, a Thumb subsidiary, with such disrespect.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Hear, hear.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Although we’re in a bad situation… The books listed on this invitation are tempting offers for sure.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: It seems that The Carnival have ended up turning into books.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: And this book… is related to the Nest of L Corp, too.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: How did you manage to collect the books we need the most?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Such is the role of the Library.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: This place exudes the smell of blood.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And you reek of blood as well, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Oh my, do we?

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: Let’s hit up a bathhouse for a warm one once we finish this.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: Good idea. There’s nothing like a good bath to blow off some steam on a bad day.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: Drinks are on me.

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Henchman
Dialog.Content: Are there even any bathhouses or pubs left in L Corp’s Nest, anyway?

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: That’s a fair point. We have so much to report and take care of, so much to think about…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Are you done with your chitchats now?

Dialog.Title: Kurokumo Captain
Dialog.Content: How pushy… Now then, shall we head inside?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: We’ll probably get even more guests trying to take over L Corp’s Nest.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You always say that. Is there any real difference?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You heard what that doghead said? Now we have the Thumb, the Index, and whatever third party she belongs to.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It doesn’t sound like a random run-of-the-mill Syndicate, seeing how she talked to the members of a Finger with so much confidence.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It seems it’s not just the major Syndicates that have incentive to be involved in a turf war like this, if smaller Syndicates are meddling in so willingly.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, basically.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Whatever goods the head honchos take interest in are naturally gonna attract the attention of those below them.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The Thumb or the Index probably won’t take direct action for now, but their subordinates are nothing to sneeze at.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Grabbing their attention might be beneficial for the Library’s wealth of info… But it’s gonna be tough for us to stop them if we escalate things any further from here.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I just hope the other Fingers stay out of this, things would get out of hand otherwise…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m fine with it as long as the results benefit us.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Yawn~ Today’s performance isn’t going too well.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Oink! You gotta keep the beat.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: District 9 is the sacred ground for music! It’s the homeland of ‘The Pianist’!

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Come on, man… I’m doing my best here.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Are you still bothered by what Heehaw said?

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Of course I am…

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: This might be our last performance ever if we go to the Library…

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Just shake off all of your worries with the exciting music~

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Oink, if you keep getting distracted by petty concerns like that and half-ass your part, I’m gonna use you as my instrument.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Seconded~

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: We can’t let some little thoughts disturb our performance already.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: You guys are still new, so you’ll have no idea the troubles we had to go through to perform back in my day~

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Me, Doodle-doo, Woof, and Heehaw formed this band and devoted all of our time to music so that we could recreate the beautiful, beautiful performance we listened to on that fateful day!

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: So quit gawking and concentrate on the music!

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: The Pianist’s performance… Yes, I know!

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: I left the Seven Association’s Section 3 and joined this band because I just couldn’t forget that sweet melody…

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: I wanted to make music like that myself… Even if it meant I have to give up everything I had…

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Yeah~ Remember the enchanting tune that echoed through the whole City.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: That grand and majestic piano made of one hundred thousand people…

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: The lovely sound created from each stroke of the tendons.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: It made me realize how beautiful the sounds a human can make in the hands of the right performer~

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Especially the ensemble with Fixers at the finale!

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: At the end of that intense concerto, the Fixers became one with the piano and assimilated into the music. How I wish I could’ve been there…

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Ahem, speaking as someone who watched the performance right at the scene, the finale was soooo wonderful, you know?

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: The musical score and notes literally unraveled before my eyes~

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: The Fixers ran across the score and charged at the Pianist…

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: They were buried under the notes one by one, their bodies blowing up…

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: But they couldn’t die there; they became part of the piano, spewing out fragrant notes.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: And the last Fixer standing was taken apart carefully, making the most splendid sound imaginable as gorgeous red notes scattered from their body.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Yes… That performance… The heavenly music that pierced me…

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Well, but then the Black Silence intervened and cut off the Pianist’s hands and head. A total mood killer.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: I wanted to be part of that performance, too~

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Sigh… I’m so jealous… I had to just sit in my Office and listen to the music coming from a distance…

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Boohoo… I wanna do it too… I wanna make music that’s half as good as the Pianist’s…

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: But look at me… No matter how much I smash the ankle bones, pluck the tendons, and scrape flesh from the splint bones of my instruments, I can’t even get close to it…

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: And Heehaw and Doodle-doo… said things…

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: No, Oink… There’s no need to be so impatient.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: It’s true that we still have a long way to go before we can perform like the Pianist did….

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: But we are getting close, you see? If we pour our heart and soul into our performance everyday, we’ll be able to make it one day…

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: The performance by Doodle-doo, Heehaw, and Woof was wonderful, wasn’t it?

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Yeah! The three gave a fantastic performance!

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: They went on a trip to prepare for the next, so we won’t get to hear it again for a while, though…

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: It was… Will I get to perform like that someday?

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Of course~ Let’s discuss this again after we finish this performance and handle the Library job Heehaw gave us.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: She said there’s gonna be a performance bigger than ever.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: And we might find new instruments in the Library, you know?

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Yeah… I’m excited to see that performance Heehaw mentioned…

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Lemme see… Aha!

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Why don’t we perform in a supermarket next time~? Oink likes supermarkets, right?

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: I’m in, too~! It’s fun to mess around with all kinds of instruments in supermarkets.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Thanks, Meow… Thanks, MuMu… I’ll practice harder!

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: All right! Gear up, everyone!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Looks like the Pianist left a whole bunch of nutjobs in its wake.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: “From break and ruin, the most beautiful performance begins…”

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What, are you interested in listening to the Pianist’s music?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: No way. I’ve heard that kind of music more than enough times.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …There was another dotty musician like the Pianist?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s similar, but not exactly the same. How about you, did you hear the Pianist’s music yourself?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Duh. It’d be a lot faster to count the people in the City that didn’t hear that damn sound.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Its music didn’t just pierce me, it almost ravaged my whole being. And then. …Nevermind. I don’t wanna remember that performance again.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyway, musicians are all molto vivace in the head, one way or another.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They seem to love performance that leads to doom, indeed…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Guess they’re living in their own world that no one else can understand.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Cat goes~!

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musicians
Dialog.Content: Meow~ Meow~

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Pig goes~!

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musicians
Dialog.Content: Oinkie~ Oink~

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Rabbit goes~!

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: …Squeak… squeak…?

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: This is so sad…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests. I am the direct—

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: MuMu~! Don’t be so down.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: But rabbits don’t have any signature cry sounds.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Then we can make one…!

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Good idea!

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Everyone…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What a load of nonsense.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Why are you just standing there, bluey hair? Aren’t you gonna let us in?

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Stupid little machine, don’t keep your guests waiting!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What?

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Puhahaha, look at it stumble~ It’s got red blood, too?

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: It can bleed, but the inside is still a bunch of metallic junk. Not a good vibe.

Dialog.Title: Bremen Musician
Dialog.Content: Hurry up and let us in before we break your legs.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What in the… Angela, what’s going on?!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s blood… I thought you were a pure machine!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I am surprised as well… That much impact shouldn’t have made me flinch, either…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You alright? Does it hurt bad?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I’m still fine. Now I see how much it hurts to get hit.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Could it be that you’re getting closer to being human…?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It may be one of the signs that I’m approaching my freedom… There’s no need to be worried just yet.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: Help yourself. You’re gonna starve to death if you don’t eat anything.

Dialog.Title: Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Thanks for the meal, but… I don’t feel like eating yet…

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: No wonder, your Office got wiped out. You should harden your heart, still.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: Do you think it was your fault?

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yes… Had I stopped them…

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Had I been stronger and more mature…

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Had I… stayed there and not run away…

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: Then it’s your fault.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Huh?

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: You were too daft and weak to keep the others safe. It’s your fault that everyone died.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: Feel better now? Think what you want.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: When something happens, all you gotta do is make up reasons that are convenient to you, no?

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: It’s not like you actually care about the cause; you just want to believe whatever that convinces you.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: Hey, kids. Don’t bully that boy too hard now.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: I didn’t do anything. It was all Pameli.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: Alright, Philip. Feeling well enough to talk now?

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yes. Thank you for your kindness.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: We are sister Offices, after all. Gotta help each other out.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: I’m sorry we couldn’t help. We were in the middle of handling a case of the Distortion in the streets of District 12.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: Those victimized by ‘The Eight o'Clock Circus’ held a show of pure insanity and hedonism.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: It was akin to a festival in hell. Gave us quite a bit of trouble.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: I had to get my body replaced, too. This one’s seriously not my style…

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Is that a robotic body? Doesn’t that shape infringe the Ethics Amendment, though?

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: It’s not mechanical, it’s a clone of my body. I got biological body-recovery insurance some time ago.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: Pameli’s body was torn apart beyond recovery, so this was the only way we had left for her.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: Her head was thankfully intact. I thought Fixer insurances were a complete robbery, but it did help us out for once.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: Speaking of, doesn’t your Office have any insurance?

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: I was a relatively new member at that Office, so I didn’t know that much…

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yeah, you’ll want to see if the Office had any. There are many types of insurance with various conditions.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: It’s nice to have a body again, but why did it have to be this?

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: What? I urgently had body cloning surgery to save you, and this is how you thank me?

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: What’s the point? Even just looking at the mirror is discouraging.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: Don’t you dare damage that body.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: You know what, why don’t you just die a permanent death this time? That way you can’t be recovered by any means. You won’t have to pay me for the cloned body then.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: You asking for a fight?

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yeah, you punk.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: …You certainly are masterful at making ssanghwa-cha as Salvador said.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: You flatter me, sir…

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: A penny for your thoughts, Philip. Did ‘The Library’ appear to be related to the Distortion Phenomenon in any way?

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: I’m not sure. I haven’t experienced the Distortion myself.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: But that place looked more alien than anything I’ve ever seen.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: And master and seonbae… They got turned into books there…

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: …That doesn’t help.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: Several Associations have started keeping an eye on this matter.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: It’s not just the Associations; even the Wings and the Fingers are clueless about what to make of the Distortion.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Alright…

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: You don’t seem too interested in the current topic.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: You must want to forget all this fuss about the Distortion and head right back to the Library and retrieve the books of your colleagues.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: …I wish I could do just that.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: But my master said to me in his note that I shouldn’t act hastily and instead depend on your aid.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: That old friend left me with quite the troublesome little fellow…

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: Death is a staple in this business, but his wife and children must be heartbroken still.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: Have you met them?

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: No… I couldn’t visit them yet.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: Why is that?

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: …I’m too ashamed to face them.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: Our next stop will be the Library. Ready your gear.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Thank you, sir.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: Don’t mistake this for kindness. We’re simply taking you with us because we were already planning to go there.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: And this is the least I can do to bear responsibility for my old friend’s death.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: Personally, I’d never let a Fixer like you join my Office. It would give us a bad name.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Is it wrong… Is it so pathetic for me to want to repay the favors of my colleagues, for their sake…?

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Everyone says not to act upon attachment, that it’s an unclassy and naive thing to do…

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Can’t we as Fixers… no, as people living in the City, do anything on the behalf of others!!!

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: Gosh, you’re insufferable. He didn’t even say that you’re wrong or anything.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: He just doesn’t want those kinds of Fixers in our Office, simple as that. Don’t be a miserable ass about it.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: Nothing is as unreliable as someone who’s easily swayed by their feelings.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: You want us all to die just so you can fulfill your ideals or what?

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: You must be sincerely believing that your actions are for others.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: That you are different from all the other unkind and selfish denizens of this City.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: Thinking that you are fighting for some higher cause.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: But know that those are in fact entirely selfish thoughts.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: It’s the most dangerous kind of selfishness. You deceive yourself into thinking you’re selfless.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: There can be no such thing as a selfless action for us humans. Even the act of self-sacrifice is ultimately for oneself.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: A very dangerous kind of selfishness, one that slowly eats away at your peers and leads them to damnation…

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: You gave a fine speech, but I must wonder if you’re truly upset for the sake of Salvador and your other late colleagues.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: …I’ll go prepare myself.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That Philip guy seems to be hurt, but I agree with Oscar here.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Few things are as dangerous and nasty as selfishness in the guise of “for the sake of someone else”…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I think I know what you mean. The determination to work for the good of others can be a dreadful and loathsome weapon.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Especially if one strongly believes that the justice they’re pursuing is worth sacrificing for…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They’re blinded by self-righteousness, and have no regards for their surroundings. They don’t care what happens to others.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They justify themselves for pressing forward pursuing their justice, crushing everything in their way…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Wow… This might be the first time we understood each other for real. I’m touched, man.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: How about some champagne?

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: Stop frowning already, would you? You’re so annoying.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: He’s still recovering. We should give him some space.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: Tiny things like this can still affect my psyche.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Nevermind. You don’t need to care about me. I’ll try not to be a hindrance.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: I’ll stab you as soon as I determine that you’re getting in our way.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests. Though, your group seems to be in a rather ill mood?

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: I thought you were a machine… But could it be that you are partially human?

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: Don’t stare at us so viciously now. We just poked you to make sure, not to kill you or anything.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: How rude. Hasn’t anyone taught you to behave?

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: Hmm, I heard the librarian of this place was supposed to be nice.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Someone advised me that there’s no need to be courteous with ill-mannered guests who slap and spit in my face without reason.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Operator
Dialog.Content: I apologize. We couldn’t afford to be polite when our very lives are at risk.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Oh, really now?

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: This isn’t like what we heard about her at all.

Dialog.Title: Wedge Fixer
Dialog.Content: She must’ve had her own woes.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Whoa… What is up with that Philip kid?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: When did he get such a high-performing workshop gear? No, not even the workshops could make equipment as good as that…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: This actually… reminds me of that guy…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: E.G.O…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That appears to be ‘E.G.O’.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: ‘E.G.O’? You mean the ego? As in someone’s consciousness?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s a silly wordplay. They’re essentially the same thing.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The shell of one’s ego. It’s a physical manifestation of the mind.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What?! The mind? Physically brought about? That sounds too vague to be a real thing that could happen.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It was the Singularity of L Corp, although the process was different…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: While L Corp. extracted E.G.O deliberately, Philip must have manifested his thanks to the influence of the White Nights and Dark Days.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Yeah, I understand somewhat now.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Put the brakes on your train of thought for a moment… You mean anyone can just extract powerful equipment like that from their mind, free of charge?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Don’t rush me. This is also my first time seeing it manifest this way.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If you were so curious, you shouldn’t have let him get away.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sigh~ I didn’t know that coot would put that kinda device on him… Old Man Oscar’s still not honest to himself.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You seem to have a number of old friends.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, yeah. They’re seasoned veterans with mountains of experience. It’s hard not to run into ‘em at least once or twice as a Fixer, y’know?
